page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF BLOCK
page.content: The area is a low land area with much of the farmland lying within a few metres of sea level. There are no hills, just a few small fen islands or tofts on which the churches usually stand.Fishtoft church being the best example. There is no industry, the only thing that is anywhere near being industrial is the agricultural suppliers at Freiston. There are three villages - Fishtoft, Freiston and Butterwick. Fishtoft and Butterwick have grown with people moving there from Boston, but there has hardly been any building at Freiston. Nearly all the land is used for arable farming, with very few animals. There are no railways or main roads except a tiny stretch of the A52 at the North-West corner.
